div.l: What Wil ye do whilis it is in hond
By god ryght by the hoper wol I stond
Quod Iohn and se how the corn gous yn
Yet sawe I neuyr by my fadyr kyn
How the hoper waggis to and fro
Aleyn answerd Iohn wolt thou so
Than wol I be benethe by my croun
And se hou the mele fallis doun
In to the trowgh that shal be my dysport
For Iohn in fayth I may be of your sort
I is as ille a Myllere as is ye
Thys myller smyled of her nycete
And thoughte al this is don but for a wyle
They wene that noman may hem begyle
But by my thrifte yet shal I blere her eye
For al her sleyghte and her philosophye
The more queynte crekis that they make
The more shal I stele whan I take
In stede of flour yet wil I yeue hem bren
The grettist clerkis be not the wysest men
As whilom to the wolf thus spak the mare
Of alle her art ne counte I not a tare
Out at the dore he goth ful pryuely
When that he sawe hys tyme softly
He lokyth vp and doun tyl he hath founde
Thyse clerkys hors where it stood y bounde
Behynde the mylle vnder a leefsel
And to the hors he goth faire and wel
He strypyth of the brydil ryght anon
And when the hors was loos he gan to gon
Toward the fenne where wilde maris renne
Forth with wehy thurgh thicke ⁊ thynne
This myller goth ayen no word he seyde
But doth his note ⁊ wyth the clerkis pleyde
Til that her corn was feire ⁊ wel grounde
And whan the mele is sackid ⁊ bounde
Thys Iohn goth forth ⁊ fynt hys hors aweye
And gan to crye harrow and wel awey
